stream_context.summary: Kaze blocks-out and refines the new Wild-West course for Return to Yoshi’s Island: adds atmosphere (tumbleweeds, new rocks, pipe redesign), builds a cowboy Shy Guy NPC, plans Monty Mole/Goomba bosses, and discusses overall game progress (120 stars done, 20 to go). He also tests performance on real N64 hardware and rejects F3D-X3 due to a 20 % FPS loss.
level: wild-west course (working titles: “High Noon Hills”, “Grandstand Badlands”)

development_findings.summary: 120 stars are playable; the team intends to add 20 more plus overworld content before release.
development_findings.quote: “120 stars are finished now, but then we want 20 more stars. We need to do some overworld stuff still.”

development_findings.summary: The Wild-West level has three areas (town, wilderness with oversized props, train station) and each star is a short outlaw story involving boss encounters with Sniffits, stacked Goombas, and a Monty Mole gang.
development_findings.quote: “This level is like old Wild West town… you solve three secrets that will each give you a star… a shootout with five Goombas, a red-coin mine full of Sniffits, and a Monty Mole robbery tunnel.”

development_findings.summary: Visual atmosphere relies on small dynamic effects (e.g., tumbleweeds spawned in front of the camera) to make the world feel alive without harming performance.
development_findings.quote: “The tumbleweed is so good… such a small addition but it gives the game like so much movement and vibe.”

development_findings.summary: Level currently runs near 60 FPS on real hardware; importing assets with F3D-X3 dropped FPS by ~20 %, so that microcode is on hold.
development_findings.quote: “I imported f3dx3 and it decreased FPS by 20 %… I’m not 100 % confident that we can use f3d x3 in the end.”

development_findings.summary: Kaze redesigned pipe models using a 2-cycle combiner, environment mapping, and vertex lighting; lighting must stay on or the env-map breaks.
development_findings.quote: “If you have lighting off your environment map doesn’t work…”

development_findings.summary: Triangle count is now treated as low-priority; focus has shifted to shading and texture efficiency, especially avoiding slow RGBA textures.
development_findings.quote: “Triangle count optimizations are completely overrated… that’s why he was so low-poly at the beginning, but now we can just add more.”

development_findings.summary: Monty Mole model from SM64 is being split, mirrored, and re-textured because original RGBA textures are too expensive.
Still undecided on giving Mario a temporary cowboy hat for this level; will depend on final aesthetic balance.
Story beats (Yoshi slave-labor idea) may be toned down; Kaze prefers to finalize the plot after all level design so the overworld can ‘fit the worlds’.
development_findings.quote: “That’s why we do the overworld last so that we can do the plot afterwards to fit the worlds.”

context_findings.summary: Kaze claims he never suffers burnout, joking he ‘doesn’t have a soul’; he stresses consistent work over motivation.
context_findings.quote: “No, I actually never suffer from burnout… I do not have a soul.”

context_findings.summary: He cycles caffeine intake and balances streaming with off-stream progress; jokes about soon becoming a father and weight-lifting personal records.
Multi-streams on Twitch & YouTube after Twitch policy change; discusses chat, music, and heater noise while working.

biobak.summary: Provided an updated pipe model with reduced shine and suggested shading tweaks; exchanged assets with Kaze during stream.
biobak.quote: “Send me the pipe model… I already sent it to MioMike.”

biobak.summary: Spotted rock shading issues and proposed texture/light fixes.

zeina.summary: Modeled Wild-West dragon enemy and new rocks; prepares cowboy Goomba/Koopa assets and cacti.
zeina.quote: “Zeina made the dragon, by the way.”

zeina.summary: Manually hand-crafted rock meshes— not procedural— and supplies them for Kaze to place.

key_stories.title: Pipe Makeover
key_stories.summary: Old pipes looked flat; Kaze and Biobak rebuilt them with two-cycle materials and environment mapping, then debated lighting trade-offs.
key_stories.challenge: Give pipes richer shading without killing FPS.
key_stories.process: Kaze built a new model on Tuesday bonus stream; Biobak proposed combiner edits and vertex-alpha shininess.
key_stories.outcome: Visual upgrade accepted but further tweaks needed to stop colour desaturation.
key_stories.key_quote: “You can’t have lighting off— the environment map breaks.”

key_stories.title: Wild-West Level in Two Weeks
key_stories.summary: Kaze binge-watched cowboy movies (‘method acting’) and, with Zeina’s assets, assembled an almost-complete three-area course in under a fortnight.
key_stories.challenge: Create a distinctive, story-driven level quickly while maintaining 60 FPS.
key_stories.process: Blocked out town, wilderness, station; added tumbleweeds, oversized props, new textures; rewrote missions as outlaw stories.
key_stories.outcome: One star already playable; NPC set and boss designs outlined; naming still in flux.
key_stories.key_quote: “Recently I have levelled up a lot of my skills and this level is the first one that has those applied.”

key_stories.title: F3D-X3 Rejection
key_stories.summary: Trying the modern microcode seemed promising but dropped frame-rate by a fifth.
key_stories.challenge: Boost graphics features with F3D-X3 without sacrificing speed.
key_stories.process: Imported assets using F3D-X3; benchmarked on hardware; observed 20 % loss.
key_stories.outcome: Decided to stay on current renderer until performance improves.
key_stories.key_quote: “Right now f3dx3 is 20 % slower… we can’t use it for now.”

open_questions.context: Kaze mentions Silas has ‘a cool idea’ to rework character squish behaviour.
questions: Which characters will it affect and why?
How will it impact gameplay or collision tuning?

open_questions.topic: Final name for the Wild-West level
open_questions.context: Multiple placeholders discussed (High Noon Hills, Grandstand Badlands, Bandit Badland).
questions: What naming conventions matter to the team?
When will the title be locked for text assets?

open_questions.context: Chat keeps requesting it; Kaze undecided.
questions: Will a temporary costume break consistency?
How expensive is per-level model swap?

open_questions.context: Early ‘Yoshi slave labor’ joke may be toned down.
questions: What story tone does the team aim for?
How will Bowser’s motive tie into each world?
Any risk of being too dark for target audience?

open_questions.topic: Adoption of F3D-X3 later in development
questions: What specific features are worth the cost?
Can optimisation reclaim the lost FPS?

open_questions.context: Overworld left for last to match plot, still largely undone.
questions: Who is responsible for its art and scripting?
How will it integrate the 20 extra stars?
